channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024070381
item.description:
Report E-2024070381

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: JEFFERSONVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On July 8, 2024, at 1745 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Jefferson, Georgia regarding the release of Caustic Soda Prills. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of Caustic Soda Prills (UN1823, 8, II). The release was caused by a rollover accident that impacted a 360ft x 50ft area of soil and an adjacent concrete lined drainage ditch that contained 635 gallons of free-standing impacted rainwater. Contractors collected the damaged cargo that was still in the trailer, neutralized and collected all free-standing liquid with a vac truck, excavated all impacted soil, then placed seed and straw. Contractors took 635 gallons of impacted rainwater in a vac truck and 11 roll-offs of impacted soil and damaged cargo offsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070369
item.description:
Report E-2024070369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10200
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The IBC was strapped in the trailer by Heritage Crystal Clean (HCC). Heritage Environmental Services (HES) employees unloaded the trailer at the Heritage Transport (HT) transfer facility. HES employees loosen the load strap which exposed a whole in the body of the IBC. The whole was 1 inch or less in size. The whole was located approximately halfway down the side of the body. HES employees secured and blocked nearby storm drains and contact an emergency response contractor to mitigate the release, transfer the remaining contents of the damaged IBC to a new container, to recover the spilled material, and to containerize absorbent materials. The duration of the release was approximately 90 minutes.

item.title: Report E-2024070204
item.description:
Report E-2024070204

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: LITHIA SPRINGS
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 125000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling on Thornton Road near Lithia Springs, Georgia. The driver took evasive action in order to avoid impacting stopped traffic and went off the roadway and rolled over. The tank trailer was compromised and approximately 350 gallons of gasoline was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
